feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Wind Advisory issued August 08 at 9:29PM AKDT until August 09 at 12:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT AKDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Southwest winds 15 to 25 mph gusting to 40 mph. * WHERE...Middle Tanana Valley. * WHEN...Until midnight AKDT tonight. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 1:10PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Continues Into Early Tuesday Morning at Shishmaref... North to northwest winds 20 to 35 mph with elevated surf west of Cape Espenberg through early Tuesday morning. Waves will wash up near the top of the beach. Minor beach erosion may occur and belongings left on the beach could wash away.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 12:35PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Cool and Wet Conditions Into Wednesday... The cool and wet pattern will persist through mid week with snow levels falling to around 2000 ft by tonight. Additional snowfall in the Alaska Range of 2 to 6 inches is expected in Denali Park, and the Eastern Alaska Range. South winds near the Alaska Range passes will gust to 55 mph
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley; Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Koyukuk Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 12:12PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow in the Brooks Range... Snow levels in the Brooks Range are around 5000 feet this afternoon and will fall to around 2000 feet overnight and Tuesday with up to 4 inches of accumulation expected by Tuesday afternoon. The heaviest snowfall will be east of the Dalton Highway. Temperatures will also be falling with the low temperatures in
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northeastern Brooks Range; Northwestern Brooks Range

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued August 08 at 9:39AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM AKDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Including the following areas, Matanuska Valley and Susitna Valley. * WHEN...Until 1045 AM AKDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 9:17AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH WATER ON AREA RIVERS AND STREAMS... Accumulated rainfall Sunday night into this morning with additional rainfall today into Tuesday may bring area creeks and streams to bankfull or slightly above bankfull. This includes, but is not limited to Ship Creek, Campbell Creek, Chester Creek and Glacier Creek (Girdwood).

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 9:45PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Showers Tonight, more Thunderstorms with a Heavy Rain Risk Tuesday... * Scattered showers with a few embedded thunderstorms will be possible overnight. With remnant cloud cover over the region, it will be a slower start for thunderstorms on Tuesday as compared to Monday.
